articles.author: Mark Schlabach
articles.title: The winners (U.S.) and losers (Europe) were clear on Day 1 at the Ryder Cup - ESPN
articles.description: The United States, looking to take back the Ryder Cup, got off to a strong start. Europe, meanwhile, struggled with its play and its decisions.
articles.content:
SHEBOYGAN, Wis. -- The European team, which had won four of five and nine of the last 12 Ryder Cups, stuck with its recipe that has worked, with nine veterans and three rookies.

articles.title: Ryder Cup: Europe drop Rory McIlroy against United States at Whistling Straits - BBC Sport
articles.description: Rory McIlroy is left out of a Ryder Cup session for the first time in his career after losing both his matches on Friday's opening day.
articles.content:
Rory McIlroy has been left out of a Ryder Cup session for the first time in his career after losing both his matches on Friday's opening day.
